MED492.name: Basics and Methods in Biomedical Research (Interim Change)
MED492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MED492.description: Introduction to research concepts, strategies, methods and laboratory techniques in biomedical research. Laboratory safety, regulations, quality control and quality assurance. Online presentations and hands-on experience.
MED492.prerequisite: {{(BS 161 or BS 181H) and (BS 171 or BS 191H)} or LB 145} and ((MTH 103 or MTH 116) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test ) and (CEM 252 or CEM 352)

MED608.name: Internal Medicine Clerkship
MED608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED608.description: Community hospital clerkship. Interviewing skills, history, physical examination. Problem solving and therapy. Care of the whole patient leading to independence in patient management.
MED608.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Human Medicine.

MED609.name: Hematology Clerkship
MED609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED609.description: Data collection, problem solving, and management related to common hematologic disorders of children and adults. Pathobiology of blood.
MED609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED610.name: Oncology Clerkship
MED610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED610.description: Data collection, problem solving and management of prevalent cancers in children and adults. Standard therapies and emerging experimental therapies. Pathobiology of cancer.
MED610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED611.name: Cardiology Clerkship
MED611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED611.description: Evaluation of patients with cardiac diseases. Special diagnostic procedures including cardiac cuticularization, phonocardiography, echocardiography, and electrocardiography. Pathobiology of heart disease.
MED611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED612.name: Nephrology Clerkship
MED612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED612.description: Integrated concepts of renal physiology and pathophysiology of renal disease. Clinical experience.
MED612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED613.name: Dermatology Clerkship
MED613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED613.description: Clinical, observational and diagnostic skills in dermatology. Treatment of common dermatologic problems in outpatient and inpatient setting.
MED613.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED614.name: Pulmonary Clerkship
MED614.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED614.description: Pulmonary pathophysiology. Evaluation of pulmonary function. Diagnosis and treatment of common pulmonary diseases. Principles and practice of mechanical ventilation.
MED614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED615.name: Gastroenterology Clerkship
MED615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED615.description: Gastrointestinal problems in ambulatory and hospital settings. Pathobiology of gastrointestinal disease.
MED615.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED616.name: Allergy Clerkship
MED616.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED616.description: Ambulatory and hospital based experience to develop diagnostic and management skills in allergy. Therapy for common allergic diseases.
MED616.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED618.name: Infectious Diseases Clerkship
MED618.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED618.description: Clinical problems in infectious and immunologic diseases. Integrated pathobiology of host defense and pathogen interactions. Standard and emerging pharmacotherapy.
MED618.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED619.name: Advanced Internal Medicine-Ambulatory
MED619.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED619.description: Clinical experiences to refine diagnostic and management skills of the complicated general internal medicine patient in the ambulatory setting.
MED619.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED621.name: Advanced Internal Medicine-Inpatient
MED621.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED621.description: Clinical experiences to refine diagnostic and management skills of the complicated general internal medicine patient in the inpatient setting.
MED621.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED622.name: Endocrinology and Metabolism Clerkship
MED622.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED622.description: Clinical and/or clinical-research experience in endocrine diseases, electrolyte abnormalities, endocrine hypertension, or diabetes mellitus. Pathobiology of major endocrine and metabolic disorders.
MED622.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED623.name: Advanced Medicine
MED623.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED623.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in diagnosing and managing acutely ill patients with non-surgical problems.
MED623.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED624.name: Geriatric Clerkship
MED624.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED624.description: Clinical experiences to refine diagnostic and management skills in elderly internal medicine patients in the inpatient, outpatient or nursing facility setting.
MED624.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED626.name: Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Clerkship
MED626.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED626.description: Rehabilitation medicine using a comprehensive, multidisciplinary approach. Regimens for physical medicine procedures, occupational therapy, rehabilitation skills. Evaluation of disabled patients. Indications for electrodiagnostic procedures.
MED626.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED627.name: Rheumatology Clerkship
MED627.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED627.description: Combined ambulatory and hospital consultative clerkship for diagnostic skills and treatment of rheumatic diseases.
MED627.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED628.name: Advanced Internal Medicine: Senior Medicine Sub-Internship
MED628.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED628.description: Advanced clinical experiences to refine diagnostic and management skills in complicated general internal medicine patients.
MED628.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED632.name: Occupational Medicine Clerkship
MED632.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED632.description: Occupational and environmental differential diagnosis of common diseases due to chemical and mineral dust, radiation, and repetitive trauma. Legal and ethical dimensions.
MED632.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
MED633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED633.description: Based in community hospitals and ambulatory sites, this is a 4 week clinical experience emphasizing interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy.

MED634.name: Advanced Internal Medicine: Intensive Care Medicine/Critical Care
MED634.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED634.description: Experience in managing critically ill patients.
MED634.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED635.name: Advanced Internal Medicine: Women’s Health
MED635.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED635.description: Clinical experience in women’s health, including normal aging, menopause, common primary care problems.
MED635.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED636.name: Advanced Internal Medicine: Medicine/Pediatrics
MED636.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED636.description: Clinical care of adults and children by internal medicine/pediatric faculty focusing on primarily ambulatory, with the potential for inpatient experiences.
MED636.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED641.name: Internal Medicine Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience
MED641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED641.description: Clinical experience in which students take primary responsibility for managing the care of adult patients under the supervision of senior residents and/or attending physicians
MED641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED643.name: Medicine Critical Care
MED643.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED643.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill adult patients.
MED643.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED644.name: Internal Medicine Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
MED644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy based in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
MED644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

MED645.name: Medicine Critical Care Remediation
MED645.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MED645.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill adult patients.
MED645.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
